Jx.Plugin.Field.Validator

Extends: Jx.Plugin

Field plugin for enforcing validation when a field is not used in a form.

License

Copyright © 2009, Jonathan Bomgardner.  Parts inspired by mootools-more’s Form.Validator class

This file is licensed under an MIT style license

Summary
Jx.Plugin.Field.ValidatorExtends: Jx.Plugin
Options
validatorsAn array that contains either a string that names the predefined validator to use with its needed options or an object that defines the options of an InputValidator (also with needed options) defined like so:
validateOnBlurDetermines whether the plugin will validate the field on blur.
validateOnChangeDetermines whether the plugin will validate the field on change.
Functions
initconstruct a new instance of the plugin.
attachSets up the plugin and connects it to the field
onPostRenderEvent handler for adding stuff directly to the DOM objects after they are rendered.
detach
getErrorsUSe this method to retrieve all of the errors noted for this field.

Options

validators

An array that contains either a string that names the predefined validator to use with its needed options or an object that defines the options of an InputValidator (also with needed options) defined like so:

{
    validatorClass: 'name:with options',    //gets applied to the field
    validator: {                         //used to create the InputValidator
        name: 'validatorName',
        options: {
            errorMsg: 'error message',
            test: function(field,props){}
        }
    }
}

validateOnBlur

Determines whether the plugin will validate the field on blur.  Defaults to true.

validateOnChange

Determines whether the plugin will validate the field on change.  Defaults to true.

Functions

init

init: function ()

construct a new instance of the plugin.  The plugin must be attached to a Jx.Grid instance to be useful though.

attach

attach: function (field)

Sets up the plugin and connects it to the field

onPostRender

onPostRender: function()

Event handler for adding stuff directly to the DOM objects after they are rendered.

detach

detach: function ()

getErrors

getErrors: function ()

USe this method to retrieve all of the errors noted for this field.
